text: Absolutely top tier service! I called several windshield replacement services and then A-1 was recommended by my vehicles dealership. resp.text: Mr Rainey, as the owner of the company, I feel that we should reply to your complaint via Google since you chose to insinuate we couldn’t honor your appointment via our Google review page.  We actually called this morning to confirm your appointment for next week and you told the customer service representative that we would have to complete your repair within 1 week or you would go somewhere else.  We explained that we cannot commit to that due to the size and complexity of the repair and the fact that dealing with your insurer (name withheld) results in a 100% guarantee that additional damage would be found as they write their estimates without a disassembly to identify all hidden damage.  They typically take 3-4 days to complete a supplement.  I truly apologize that we were unable to meet your expectations, however, we would rather you and all customers know up front that a repair cannot be performed within those expectations when we know that it cannot be done that rapidly.  To tell you otherwise would simply be telling a lie to get you in the door and then you would be more upset after finding out that’s what we did to get your sale.  We don’t want our customers to endure that.  Best of luck in getting your repairs completed.

name: Brandon Butler
text:
I contacted Magic City Glass after seeing a recent Groupon deal  on windshield repair.  I had a rather large spider web-like crack in my windshield and decided to call to see if it could even be repaired.  I spoke with Brad, the owner, who was more than willing to help with the questions I had.  It was a few days before I was able to get the repair done but as soon as I contacted Brad, he had one of his technicians get in touch with me right away to make arrangements for getting the repair done.  I made arrangements with Kris to meet at a location convenient for both of us that same day.  Kris was very professional in his work, explaining the entire process to me as he worked and even took care of a couple of minor pits and scratches on my windshield that I hadn't even called them about.  The repair took probably the better part of an hour, but Kris was also working on two small chips in my wife's windshield as well.  All in all, we are happy with the results.  The repair saved us a ton of money in new glass and we don't have to worry about these chips leading to larger cracks.  One thing to remember, if you are getting a large area repaired, you should expect to see some evidence of the original damage remaining visible.  The material used to fill the cracks is good, but may not have quite the clarity of the rest of the glass after the repair is done.  This is a fact for any glass repair job and not the fault of Magic City Glass.

This was a long review, but I wanted to tell my story for others to see.  I am quite picky with my vehicles and would recommend Magic City Glass to anyone needing glass repair.  They are courteous, prompt, honest and want to do what it takes to make a customer happy.  I did not need any headlight restoration work done, but understand that they do great work in that area as well.  Support a locally owned small business and give them a call!  I'm glad I did.

name: Trey Wimberley
text:
It took a couple days of me calling them to schedule the repair as they are not very good about answering their phone. Once the guy came out to do my repair, it only took about 45 minutes to do the windshield replacement. Once I got out to my vehicle, during the installation process I had gotten several scratches on my roof from replacing the windshield. I was a little taken back, but I use Turtle Wax Professional Rubbing Compound a lot to get out scratches that haven't taken the clear coat off and I got the majority of the scratches off. All but a few were off from the wax.

Well about 48 hours go by, and I started taking pictures of my vehicle to get it ready to be sold and there is a crack coming from the passenger side. I had not hit a rock or anything and it had only been 2 days. I had driven a total of 26 miles. I paid $200 for the windshield repair, which totaled out to be $100 per day with not crack in my windshield. Crazy stuff.

This was just 2 days ago. In the past 24 hours I have called them (not exaggerating) 12 times. I have left 2 voice messages, 1 just explaining my situation and 1 rather annoyed that it has taken this long to get back with me.

I would not recommend this company to anyone looking to get a windshield replaced. They are without a doubt the cheapest option but had I known that this was going to be the outcome, I certainly wouldn't have used them. I will update my review if I am somehow able to get in touch with them and get this worked out.

resp.text: The first rule of auto glass is to never set anything, tools or parts on the roof of a car, we've never done that in 33 yrs. We've seen customers get a rock chip within 30 minutes of a new windshield replacement, this customer had 2 days to catch new damage, the windshield was not broke when he inspected the car and signed a receipt. Iam sure he was upset that he paid 200 then the glass got hit to soon and wanted a free replacement, then dialed the wrong number, then tells the world that we scratched the top of his car to make us look bad. THIS IS NOT HOW WE DO BUSINESS HERE AT CHAMBERS AUTO GLASS. THANKS.

They even repaired some minor issues because they felt it wasn't right to return my car to me without it being in tip top shape. Their work ethic puts customers first and works in their best interest. If I ever have car troubles again, I'm definitely returning here!

name: Brandon Butler
text:
I contacted Magic City Glass after seeing a recent Groupon deal  on windshield repair.  I had a rather large spider web-like crack in my windshield and decided to call to see if it could even be repaired.  I spoke with Brad, the owner, who was more than willing to help with the questions I had.  It was a few days before I was able to get the repair done but as soon as I contacted Brad, he had one of his technicians get in touch with me right away to make arrangements for getting the repair done.  I made arrangements with Kris to meet at a location convenient for both of us that same day.  Kris was very professional in his work, explaining the entire process to me as he worked and even took care of a couple of minor pits and scratches on my windshield that I hadn't even called them about.  The repair took probably the better part of an hour, but Kris was also working on two small chips in my wife's windshield as well.  All in all, we are happy with the results.  The repair saved us a ton of money in new glass and we don't have to worry about these chips leading to larger cracks.  One thing to remember, if you are getting a large area repaired, you should expect to see some evidence of the original damage remaining visible.  The material used to fill the cracks is good, but may not have quite the clarity of the rest of the glass after the repair is done.  This is a fact for any glass repair job and not the fault of Magic City Glass.

This was a long review, but I wanted to tell my story for others to see.  I am quite picky with my vehicles and would recommend Magic City Glass to anyone needing glass repair.  They are courteous, prompt, honest and want to do what it takes to make a customer happy.  I did not need any headlight restoration work done, but understand that they do great work in that area as well.  Support a locally owned small business and give them a call!  I'm glad I did.

text: I had a bad crack in my Malibu windshield. I was told by other companies in town that it was irreparable and had to be replaced. I was able to get it repaired while I washed and vacuumed and can hardly tell there was ever a crack at all. Great service and price will use again and recommend.

name: Daniel Weatherford
text:
Tired of looking at a frosty window.

Pros: Price

Cons: Talks a good talk, but doesn't stand by warranty.

Unfortunately, I would not recommend. Had a 5'x6' window installed on ground level. Installers caulked the outer edges of the window before installing and proceeded to set it on the ground to get a better grip, I guess, picking up mulch and clippings in the sealant. Then seated it with the debris in the seal. I didn't complain and there were no leaks. I forgot about it.

Less than 2 years later, the whole window is completely frosted. Called July 10th about warranty on window, was told there would be a warranty on the window. Took a week for him to pull the paper work. Took almost two weeks for him to call the manufacturer one time, only to leave a VM. No follow up call to them for a week. I've called about twice a week every week since this started and am getting no where. Coming up on a month and has not even made contact with someone at the manufacturer.

Buyer beware.

name: Adam Swanner
text:
They gave my wife a quote for $500 to replace her windshield.  The problems began when the tech showed up over two and a half hours  late to the appointment, then he informed her that they ordered the wrong glass, and that the price would now be over $900 to get the right glass.  When I called them to ask if they would stand by their original quote I was given lots of excuses about how their receptionist made a mistake and that we just spoke to the wrong person, basically saying it wasn't their problem.  After a short argument about standing behind your word, she requested a copy of the quote (knowing full well that it was quoted over the phone) and hung up on me.  I called back and was told that they couldn't afford to even give me a discount after wasting three hours of my wife's time, much less stick to the original quote they gave us.

I can understand making a mistake, or having an employee make a mistake, but at the end of the day small businesses fail or prosper based on their image and customer support.  They weren't willing to do ANYTHING to make the situation right, not even apologize for the mistake.

resp.text: Sorry you had a problem Adam, however if we had the wrong windshield perhaps we got incorrect information on what style, or equipment your vehicle had. We would not have inadvertently carried the wrong windshield to be installed unless we were getting incorrect information, and if that was the case of course we would not honor the original price if your windshield had more options on it then what we were told no one would. I would also like to add we usually do not give an exact time 4 mobile installations as to the fact there are so many variables that could keep us from making it to you in an exact time such as traffic, or mechanical breakdowns, the technician will normally give you a text or a phone call when we are providing mobile service to a customer and should never give an exact time.

name: Stephanie Newton
text:
I decided to use A Glass Company from the great reviews on Google. I called and received a quote over the phone to replace my windshield. The price was well below Safelite and about average with other quotes. I made an appointment for the next morning and it was ready by noon.  Overall, the entire process was very simple, quick and to the point. The staff were friendly and professional. The inside of the business was also clean and tidy.

I do have one complaint though, and I try my best not to give poor reviews. Also, seeing that 90% of the reviews are good, maybe it was just a fluke, but important to note nonetheless. When I picked up the car, the windshield placement looked fine (from what a non experienced person could tell) but the inside dash had a layer of fine and semi-fine glass shards mixed with rubber debris. It was even inside my air vents so I couldn't turn on the air for fear that the glass particles would end up all over me. Also there were some on the floor and cup holders. I had to clean this up immediately once I got home. I wouldn't have minded so much if it was just plastic/rubber debris, because I've come to expect when you have work done on your car, they leave a little mess, but this was glass and that is not acceptable.

resp.text:
Stephanie,

I truly apologize for your vehicle not being cleaned to your satisfaction.  You are absolutely correct that this is unacceptable.  We always clean up any debris that is caused by the installation, but for some reason it was overlooked on your vehicle and I apologize.  Our goal is for all our customers to have a 5 star experience.  I have emphasized this with all of our glass technicians to be sure that this does not occur again.  Thank you for your business and I can assure you that if you need our services again this will not be an issue.  Thank you for your input as this will help us to improve so all of our customer have a 5 star experience.

Thank you,

Bill
A+ Glass Company, LLC

Took it back to him to try and get it fixed & he said he was finished with it. My husband called him and asked him what he could do about it, Keith laid the phone down and walked off! If you cant stand behind your work, you shouldn't be in business. We ALWAYS stand behind out work that we do at our shop! If our customer isn't happy, we fix it, even if we lose money. Its worth the customer being happy!

resp.text:
Wendy,@ NuVintage Corvette,It is true that you brought me a windshield,gasket, and trim, but not the car.What you are not saying is these parts were aftermarket and you had previously installed them on a car.That makes them used aftermarket parts, which I charged you $100.00 to put together. I cannot and will not warranty the fit and function of your used parts. I am not sure why you would use used parts on a "$80k Car" your words.. Had you chosen to do the job with quality parts, the cost would have been $4850.00. But I am sure your customer would have been happy with the outcome of his vintage corvette.
Have a blessed day, Joy @A Glass Company

Changed a windshield on my Mustang Convertible about half year ago. Service and quality are absolutely good. Price is affordable. Only one spot I can mention is small glass pieces left near gear shifter after unmounting rearview mirror. Guys, it will be better if you'll remove them yourself!
Anyway, still 5 stars.

resp.text: Mr. Sagdullin, We appreciate your business and thank you for bringing this to our attention.  We strive to clean all cars upon completion and I am sorry we overlooked this. Thanks again for the good review.

name: Jarrod Southworth
text: Great Job!! Great Prices!! Great installer's!! They had my old windshield out and my new one installed in under 15 minutes.. Will be recommending to friends, family, and acquaintances..

resp.text: Thank You, Jarrod!! We appreciate your business!!

name: Tina Pynes
text: Small place with super friendly staff and prompt service.

resp.text: Thank you for you business! We really appreciate it!

name: Dan Keys
text:
I needed to replace the windshield on my car after a tree branch cracked it.  As I was not filing an insurance claim, I was eager to find someone who would do a top notch job and not have to pay dealership prices.  I almost went with a nationally known auto glass company but found several positive reviews about A Glass Co.  I was a bit astonished at how much cheaper he could do it, using quality parts.  Glad I decided to give the local guy my business.
Keith explained my options on the phone about what quality glass to use (I went with the OEM brand), and let me know we could go with the slower drying adhesive for a super strong seal.  He did a great job, got it fixed at the shop in about 3 hours.  I felt like if anything wasn't to my satisfaction, he would make it right.  I would recommend this shop to anyone in the Huntsville area.

name: Jennifer Selock
text: Best guys around hands down! My new winshield installation was flawless! Real professional & experienced! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND A+ Glass Company, LLC for all of your automotive glass needs!! Best prices too. Safelite, glass masters,  etc.... can't beat  A+ prices & service hands down!!

resp.text: Thank you for your business!! We really appreciate it!!

name: Michael Gonzalez
text: Incredible customer service and a great staff. We've had 3 windshields repaired here and they even fixed the weather seal free of charge years later. Couldn't ask for better service.

name: Chris Bond
text: Great place to go! Good price good customer service and quick work! I just found my new auto glass replacement guy!

name: Bryan Harris
text: Very happy with these folks, they worked me in very quickly, and Keith did a great job explaining/showing me what the problem was and what needed to be done.  He was right on time with the work, and did a great job.  Highly recommended.

name: Keith Powell
text: I got a couple of lower quotes from other companies but the Google reviews convinced me to choose A+. Glad I did. I arrived at the shop for the appointment and was leaving with my new windshield in about an hour. The staff was very friendly and easy to talk to.

resp.text: Thank you and we really appreciate your business!!

text: I've dealt with Safelite previously. They're ok, but these folks are more friendly, just as efficient, and less expensive. I'll definitely be back (if necessary).

resp.text: Thank you for your business!!! We really appreciate it!!!

name: David Allgood
text: A+ Auto Glass is awesome.  Everyone in the process was pleasant and friendly.  The price was competitive and the service excellent.  We had 2 winshilds replaced at our house guickly and professionally.  I highly recommend A+ for anyone's auto glass needs.

resp.text: Thank you for your business!!! It is really appreciated!!!

name: Jeff K
text: Three to four months after being replaced, the windshield cracked starting at the very bottom where nothing could have hit it. It was cracked on the inside of the vehicle. I took it back to A+. After looking at it, they replaced the glass at absolutely no charge because the glass was defective when it was installed. It had a very small chip on the bottom edge and normal stress caused it to crack. A+ does great work and if there is a real problem with the product or the workmanship, they stand behind it. I can't recommend them highly enough. I will go back to A+ Glass Company for any and all of my auto glass needs.

resp.text: Thank you for your business, we really appreciate it.  We are glad we could remedy this situation for you.  We stand behind our work 100% of the time.

name: Carolyn Fuller
text: I had an appointment at the competition (safelite) drove 45 minutes to the appt the next morning to be told that the replacement was damaged and could I come back that afternoon.  I asked why I was not called to save a trip and was told lightly yes we should have. Asked about coming to me, but could not schedule it until sometime in the next week....as I left not happy of course I googled A1 talked to a very pleasant young lady who quickly gave a quote and told me they could come to me the very next morning.  The tech called when he was on his way and when he arrived.  Very professional and explained care. Very pleased!  Will be calling very soon for the car windshield to be replaced. Very professional and skilled.

resp.text: We really appreciate your business!!  Thank you for the awesome review, but we are A+ Glass Company instead of A1.  No offense taken but just a correction.  Thank you and please call us again.

name: Jason Walter
text: Great service! Just got my truck windshield replaced. Pretty good customer service as well.

resp.text: Thank you for your business!! We really appreciate it!!

name: Casey Holmes
text:
I recently had my windshield replaced by these guys, and it couldn't have been any better.  -- Great price, great customer service, quality install, and now my 240sx is a much better car to look at without the eyesore of a smashed windshield.
They installed new rubber sealing along the outside as well, which helps since the old molding was dried up garbage.  Also, my old windshield was a replacement as well (not original Nissan) and was an inferior install to A Glass Company's replacement.
I've already put the car through its paces, out drifting in heavy rain, yet my new windshield is completely leak free -- even with all the added stresses that drifting adds by flexing the car's chassis.
My ALFA insurance agent highly recommended these guys, and I understand why.  I will undoubtedly give them my business again, and I've recommended them to numerous friends.

name: John David
text: I had A Glass come out and install a new windshield on my C3 Corvette. Keith was very prompt in arrival and got straight to work. After removing the old glass he showed me where the frame had some rust and then explained how I could repair it myself and even went so far as to tell me exactly how he would do it if it were in his shop. After repairing the rust I rescheduled for today- and Keith showed up again, cleaned the area, installed the new glass and chrome trim, and installed my new weatherstripping. I could not have asked for a better experience from him. I will be taking all of my cars to him from now on. It is not always easy to find places you can trust- but A Glass is one of them for me.

name: John Harchanko
text: Clean facilities, professional service. Bill helped resolve an issue with the insurance company and handled inaccurate information smoothly. Vehicle was done before I expected.

resp.text: Thank you for your business, we really appreciate it!!!

name: Austin Bradley
text:
Absolutely terrible experience. I had my windshield replaced by them and had to be replaced again due to a defect in the replacement windshield and for excessive wind noise. The second install was worse than the first even though I was told it was going to be done properly this time and done by Keith himself. It was absolutely terrible. Any person could look at the seal and tell it was not right. It didn't even cover the glass all the way around. So now I have to have it replaced for the third time and pay for it to be done twice.

I do NOT recommend going to A Glass Company and I will be sure to let anyone I know will know to stay away.

resp.text:
Mr.Bradley,
I am sorry for your inconvenience , and would be happy to refund you the labor fee.You requested the cheapest windshield and molding to be put in your 1998 BMW 528, had you requested the OE replacement you would not have the problems you are having with the fitting to your specification .As you know there was a price difference, your cost was $230.00 and the OE windshield and molding was $846.49.You were pleased with the outcome when you picked up your car, if you had an issue, you should have brought it to my attention. On my part the install looked fine to me.But as I said if you want to drop by we can refund you the labor cost for this job.Sorry for your trouble. The first windshield had a distortion in it that I failed to see upon installing, but I promptly ordered you another one.

name: EastTN Ford
text:
The owners of A Glass Company are the best in Huntsville and the best I have ever had the pleasure of working with including the state of Tennesse.  Being a 3 time customer, they have replaced my previously poorly installed, and cracked winshield on my 2000 Chevy Silverado, as well as, both the front and rear OEM Lof glass and new old stoc trim on my 1967 Camaro, (Not the cheap Chinese Repro stuff).  I was never once concerned whether they would do an A++ quality job on my Classic Camaro. I ordered a very, very expensive New front windshield with the original Date Code and the Lof Glass logo engraved on it.  Also, I ordered new old stock, "Original" Stainless trim to put on both the front with the new windshield and they removed and replaced of the original back glass and trim.  They were happy to get me right in and completely explained exactly the procedure for installation and using the correct sealant.  The owners are the best and most humble people and they do better quality work than anyone!  The one person who wrote a negative response on these folks has no idea what they are talking about and their post should not be given any credit whatsoever.

Mark

I left my car over night and when I returned the following morning at10:00 the job was complete . the  pricing was reasonable with no hidded charges . I highly recomend them .

name: Eric Powell
text: Excellent job! Fast and friendly! I’ve come back many times over the years with different vehicles and every experience was fast and painless. With my most recent visit, despite the damage being smaller than a dollar bill and GEICO approving the repair, everywhere else I tried said they wouldn’t fix it. They “couldn’t” even stop the crack from spreading. I had just replaced the windshield two years prior. Hoover Windshield Repair repaired it with no problem and guarantees the repair. Hoover Windshield Repair only does repairs, no replacements. The difference I found was everybody with a vested interest in replacing windshields told me they “couldn’t.” Hoover Windshield Repair said “we can” when others wouldn’t.

text: The owner of this place does a very good, reasonably-priced work on windshield chips, and he offers a life-time guarantee for his work. I had a chip on my windshield about 5-6 years ago that he repaired, and when it started becoming more visible about 3 years ago I went back to him. He did a touch-up on that chip for no extra charge! So, obviously when I got another windshield chip a few weeks ago, I went back. He fixed the new chip for 40$, and did another touch up on the old one  for free. I can't recommend him enough!

text: Van was super kind and completely understood that I was in a rush. He got me taken care of very quickly and did an incredible job. Literal 10/10! Best price & best service.

text: I've had a handful of these windshield repairs over the years.  Almost all with good results.  But I have to say I wouldn't hesitate to go to this place again.  Don't rush the guy--some quality repairs may be done in 20 minutes, but if it takes extra time, let him do it.  It'll be worth it.  Great service, friendly, knowledgeable, and went "the extra mile" even though mine was an insurance claim.

I would recommend Hoover windshield repair to my family and friends.

Also, there was another car that got there the same time as me and he was working on both of our cars at once instead of leaving one of us waiting. Would definitely recommend this place every time!

name: Doug 9044
text:
I contacted these guys to install the rear glass and a new windshield in my 93' Toyota Paseo, nothing out of the ordinary. They come out during normal business hours so I was unable to be there but I had my father let them into my garage. The guy called me and said he's never seen this type of car and he was " pretty sure" he could put the front windshield in right but knew he could do the back. I just told him not to install the front since he had no clue what to do. Then he install the rear with their universal molding, which is fine since Toyota didn't have it available anymore.
I got home and looked over the job, it was horrible. He had installed the rear windshield way out of sort, it wasn't positioned in the opening evenly as it is extremely too far forward, to the point that there's a 3/4 inch gap at the bottom. Even with the gap they only installed their molding around the top and two sides leaving the huge gap in plain sight.
I called the owner the next day and he was horribly rude, told me he wouldn't come back and to take it to a paseo specialist. Clearly I took it to a hack.
I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy, not only do they perform poor installations they owner has a filthy mouth when speaking to you about it.

name: Connor Gaston
text:
They replaced glass on both of my cars. One car wasn't a problem. My SUV was more difficult. I asked for good quality glass and I'm not exactly sure what I got.
I wanted the glass installed following the instructions spelled out in the factory Service Manual. When I would explain to the installers how it NEEDED to be done they pushed back by saying that was not necessary. My SUV has a specific way to install the windshield that is out of the ordinary. If steps aren't followed then its going to leak. They assured me that it wouldn't leak the way they did it and I really did not want to put that to the test with their way of doing it. I supplied my own new factory gasket for the job. If I had not had that they would have reused the 20 year old gasket that was glued to the old windshield. The manual says to use a NEW gasket.

All the glass installers I have delt with to get this done have just about all been the same. They are payed by they job and want to get done and on to the next job. I care about my car and if I'm gong to pay to have this done I want it done right. As the customer they need to consider that I probably have a good idea what I'm talking about and should listen and absorb what I'm telling them because I didn't want it to leak and I know they didn't want to have to come back and fix it.

My experience with the installers that came today was the reason for the bad rating. I don't appreciate their attitude towards my instructions I had for them.  I walked inside to get cash to pay them while they were working and quietly came back outside to hear them talking about me and how I was trying to micromanage them.  One of the guys actually told me he could see why they other companies didn't want to do the job. Which was a rude thing to say. He couldn't handle I wanted things done a certain way (the correct way).

I'm sure most windshields are simple and easy to replace. If you have any specifics on how your car windshield should be done like I did then skip this company. Along with Cassady and Self. They were worse.

name: Garrett Klaver
text: I want to personally thank  Ben for saving my family vacation.  Long story short. I hit a large bird in GA and had a severely damaged windshield that could barley be driven. Ben tracked a windshield down within an hour for me. The windshield was 1 hour south at a windshield distributor. He offered up his time to follow me there and install the windshield in the parking lot. He literally saved me and my family from a really bad situation.  He and his employee didnt have to do this but he said "you need the help so I am going to take care of you" Ben Pomeroy is a stand up man and it gives hope that there are some good quality business owners out there... I have no affiliation with this company.
